name: Olympia Aviation (Detroit Red Wings) MD-81 [N682RW] Taxi and Takeoff from Calgary Airport ᴴᴰ
description:
Olympia Aviation has been operating this McDonnell Douglas MD-81 for the Detroit Red Wings for several years now, and this is the first time I've managed to catch it. Aside from being a member of the MD-80 family, an already unique family of aircraft in this day and age, it is only one of 6 MD-81s still flying in the world, and the only one in North America. This 36-year old bird certainly looks and sounds fantastic, and I'm very glad I had the opportunity to do so! Enjoy this special video, featuring some close ups of the aircraft, a brief view of the loading, engine start up, taxi, and takeoff en route to Edmonton, with ATC included!

Also, for my more hockey-centric followers, they were in town to play the Calgary Flames, and lost 3-2. 

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: Olympia Aviation
Aircraft: McDonnell Douglas MD-81 (M81)
Aircraft Name: None
Engines: 2x PW JT8D-217
Registration: N682RW 
Route: YYC-YEG
Callsign: November 682 Romeo Whiskey
Runway used: 35L
